user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I was looking for a blush palette that was a good size for travel and versatile enough for any look. I love the colors in this trio for my fair skin but my only complaint would be the middle shade is packed with gold glitter. I am not a fan of glittery blushes so I don’t foresee myself getting as much use out of the middle shade, which is unfortunate because it is a beautiful pop of pink. (I put a close up picture of the blushes to show the glitter in the middle shade) My go to has been the far right “Kash” but I also love the neutral mauve tone of “Blank” - they are also really nice mixed together! These blushes are pigmented and they do build nicely. When I wear “Kash” I notice there’s a really nice glow to my cheeks. I noticed a lot of people complaining about the pan size and yes, they are a little narrow so you do have to be really careful with how you angle your brush in the pan in order to only get the color you want.. but I wouldn’t consider that a deal breaker because I personally love the size for both travel and keeping in my purse. Also, the mirror in the compact is a nice bonus. Aside from travel, I also commute by train during the week and sometimes have to finish or touch up my face makeup - this mirror is perfect for that!

review_title: Pink Passion is great on my pale complexion
review_content:
I tend towards pinky blushes, so I picked up the "Pink Passion" trio and hoped it wouldn't be too intense on my pale complexion. I found the blush to be very buildable, and all three I love and know I will use a lot! The darkest shade is nice and dramatic, the middle shade is the perfect blush for daytime looks, and the peachy-pink is just lovely with neutral toned lipstick/more red-orange toned eye-makeup looks. The only possibly fault of this blush trio is that the pans are quite narrow, so it is hard to reach the middle shade if your blush brush is too wide/fluffy.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Now that Nars is no longer a cruelty free brand I was in search of a new blush and these palettes are amazing! I have fair skin with cool undertones and dark hair and I find every shade in the Pool Party palette to be very wearable. Its my ideal palette, with a beige shade for bronzing and a pink and a peach shade. All of the shades are matte. The pink is supposed to be "matte with gold sparkles" but I don't see the sparkles at all when I apply it to my skin. This is very pigmented, so use a light touch to avoid over doing it and the palette will last a long time. Some reviewers have commented that the pans are too small or narrow, but I think the size is idea for travel. I use the Sigma blush brush and it fits nicely swiping up and down the pan. I like this so much I intend to buy the Pink Passion palette so I can try the satin finishes.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
The packaging is absolutely beautiful, didn’t realize until I unboxed, the colors of the peachy trio are everything I ever wanted from a blush. Although they’re pigmented, they aren’t going to make your cheeks look crazy, because the colors are so natural and beautiful it just looks like your cheeks are very flushed. The only blushes that I think would be a dupe for this is the warm blush palette from Morphe that has peaches and corals, but Morphe’s is so pigmented that it looks bad quicker. I also love that these blushes make my pores vanish, don’t emphasize texture WHATSOEVER, and my cheeks just look so dang pretty after applying. I’ve never found a blush that minimizes pores, typically they bring them out either with the color or formula, but not with these blushes. Will be buying more!

The quality of the blushes in this lil blush trio is great, but I hate how small the pans are - it's really annoying to use this because I have to try to fit my large blush brush into the tiny little pans and try not to pick up only the color I want to use and not accidentally dip into the other shades. I found this for a really good price at TJ Maxx, and I feel like it was worth that price, but I wouldn't recommend getting this at the full $30 retail price as I don't think it's worth that much. I have this trio in the shade Peachy Love and I love all 3 colors, but be aware that the middle color is matte but the two outside colors both have a little shimmer/glitter in them. It's not very noticeable when applied to the face, but if you hate non-matte blushes, you might want to avoid this.

review_content: This was my first ever experience trying ABH blushes. (Not gonna lie I got mine from TJ Maxx. All their little blushes are easily found there— and only for $10.99). I highly recommend these. They’re pigmented and beautiful. Easy to blend. Also cute packaging.

review_content: LOVE this. I don't use the middle shade in pool party, but absolutely love the other two and it's become my go-to.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love Anastasia eyeshadow palettes, so I was so excited to try this blush trio (thinking the color payoff would be similarly amazing!) Unfortunately, this was not the case for me. I purchased in "pink passion" and not only were the shades unflattering, but the formula made my cheeks look splotchy and uneven.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I wish the price tag on these tiny things would go down but it is what it is. I’ve had this blush for over a year now though and I still love it. It applies on smoothly. The material itself is compact and hasn’t broken out into a powdered mess yet (I have a naughty 3 year old who loves to throw my makeup). Pigmented enough? Yes. I have to tap out my blush brush after I get some on because it’s highly pigmented, which is great. This just means this thing will last you a long time. And the great thing is, it doesn’t cause breakouts.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I went back and forth between purchasing this because of the $30 price tag, but I was on the hunt for an orange blush. I love using the muted pink on the eyes. The orange blush brightens the face really welll and the formulas are soft. I would say the pigment is pretty strong but if you start soft it builds up beautifully! It’s also a bonus that it’s vegan!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: Great product. Texture is amazing. Goes on smooth and all three colors blend really well together or each one works well on its own.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I have been searching for the perfect blush color for years now. All three shades look fantastic with my skin tone. The only reason I did not give five stars is that is doesn't last as long as the rest of my makeup. I love that it does NOT sparkle/glimmer/etc except for one shade and that one is very subtle.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Perfect Blush Trio for my Skin Tone
review_content:
Yup I am happy with this trio. It's been awhile since I purchased a blush palette and all the colors worked on me. I'm like caramel going on mocha and I love each color on me. I'm not a diehard blush collector and wanted a palette with more than one color I could travel with, and this is perfect. But for those who use it - a little goes a long way. Definitely start with a little and build up. This will last you awhile. Very happy with my purchase. Heck yes I'd recommend, you can't go wrong with one of these ABH blush trios. Find one that works with your skin tone and buy it!
